meanings.definition: To form or develop epithelial tissue.
meanings.sent1: The wound will epithelialize over time, healing from the inside out.
meanings.sent2: The skin will epithelialize to protect the underlying layers.
meanings.sent3: I hope my pancakes epithelialize perfectly, creating a smooth surface.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness began to epithelialize around his heart, forming a protective layer.
meanings.sent5: The seeds will epithelialize into beautiful flowers, blooming in the spring.

meanings.definition: To cover or line with epithelial cells.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon will epithelialize the exposed area to promote healing.
meanings.sent2: The body will naturally epithelialize the damaged tissue to repair itself.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to epithelialize the baking pan with butter for easy removal.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to epithelialize the old house, giving it a mysterious appearance.
meanings.sent5: The protective film will epithelialize the screen, keeping it scratch-free.
